item.title: Multiple SSH Keys settings for different github account
item.description: Check existing keys $ ssh-add -l Create different public key create different ssh key according the article Mac Set-Up Git cd ~/.ssh ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "bustroker@email.com" -f "github_bustroker" ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "bkr@email.com" -f "github_bkr" The -C option is a comment to help identify the key. The -f option specifies the file name for the key pair. for example, 2 keys created at: ~/.ssh/github-bustroker ~/.ssh/github-bkr then, add these two keys as following
